summary: Nuclear security refers to the regulatory framework and measures implemented within the European Union to safeguard nuclear materials and facilities from theft, sabotage, and other malicious acts. This concept encompasses a range of legal instruments, including directives and regulations that establish stringent security standards for nuclear installations. The EU promotes cooperation among member states to enhance nuclear security through information sharing and joint exercises. Additionally, the European Atomic Energy Community (EURATOM) plays a pivotal role in ensuring compliance with international obligations, thereby reinforcing the overall safety and security of the nuclear sector across Europe.
